title: Boot multiple ISOs from Hard Drive

forumNotes.author: Yoav
forumNotes.content:
Hi Guys,   

I know this isn't really related to this forum but I'm looking for a solution for a problem I have. I'm a computer technician, and being one I go around installing CD's all the time. I have a pack of CD's with me, I usually carry discs like:  

*Windows XP - Windows 2000 - Windows Vista (32/64 bit) - Windows Seven (32/64 bit) - Slax live linux - Ultimate Boot CD - Mac OSX 10.4 - Mac OSX 10.5 - Mac OSX 10.6*   
and I'd really love to STOP carrying these discs and instead put them all on my 500GB external USB hard drive.  

I already have them on the drive as ISOs (for backup) but what I really want to do is just BOOT from the usb drive, and then get a menu that asks me which iso I want to boot from, I choose it and - TADAM! the computer boots from that ISO.  

I already know there is no program that does this, but at this point I will **PAY GOOD MONEY** if somebody can do this for me.  

If it's not possible through a hard drive, I can also consider a solution that involves an SD Card reader and multiple micro SD cards (if that would be fast enough)  

If anybody wants to take on this project please e-mail me a quote to **INFO \<AT\> SPEEDGEEKNY \<DOT\> COM**   

Thank you!

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> I already know there is no program that does this, but at this point I will **PAY GOOD MONEY** if somebody can do this for me. Completely wrong approach. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) You start with some presumptions: * that such a program does not exist * that what you want to do is booting the .iso's (while what you REALLY want to do is to install different OS from an external USB device, which is NOT the same thing) * that the "services" of members are for hire
There is a program (more than one actually) and it's free. Read here: [http://www.msfn.org/...s-usb-f157.html](http://www.msfn.org/board/install-windows-usb-f157.html "External link") [http://www.msfn.org/...s...44.html\&hl=](http://www.msfn.org/board/install-usb-winsetupfromusb-gui-t120444.html&hl= "External link") SOME (NOT "all", NOT "any") .iso's can be chainloaded from hard disk: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=5041](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=5041 "External link") Read attentively this: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=8944](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=8944 "External link") The above will cover anything but the Mac OS ones, or maybe even those, but there aren't reports AFAICR. :smile: jaclaz P.S.: I see that you have already been here, asking the same things more or less, and have been given the same answers more or less: [http://www.boot-land...?...ic=6715\&hl=](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=6715&hl= "External link") and then vanished. :wink:
